confession.seduction_context: In her house, lamenting execution of her mother and fearing 'la deshonneur du monde'. Given money which turned to leaves and powder (black to cure, white to heal).

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had taken her husband to court 3 years before to obtain reparation for insults, after which they hated him
Witnessed suspicious behavior at communion - curé told Sebille twice to stop lifting hand to mouth after taking host. Mourxat spoke to others about this, causing Sebille to hate him.
testimony.threat_quote: said she would never forgive him

testimony.quarrel_subject: She was very angry with him after he went drinking with her husband. Also complained they had refused her some milk.
Husbands had been to law over 'retraicte' of a plot of land

witnesses.name: Didier Chottey
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former landlord - daughter lived in their house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had several times quarrelled with daughter when living in their house
Previous Christmas Sebille had been very angry when she refused her milk
Hatred over a towel she had wanted returned, claiming to have lent it to first wife of her husband

witnesses.name: Sebille fille Didier Chottey
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former housemate - lived in their house 5 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrels when she lived in their house 5 years earlier
Witness told her she was 'bien sot' to go and see child of Demenge Mathieu when she was suspected of bewitching him; Sebille left abruptly
Several refusals of milk and butter
Quarrel at time of last harvest
Had been to La Chapelle to buy a broom, paid 2 ecus on credit, then remembered he had promised to lend them to Sebille

timeline.subject: Sebille Pescheur
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves arrest and interrogation

timeline.subject: Sebille Pescheur
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied all charges except minor quarrels

timeline.subject: Sebille Pescheur
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - confessed immediately upon thumbscrews

timeline.subject: Sebille Pescheur
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy

accomplices_named.name: Didier Grand Claudon
accomplices_named.context: Danced with her several times at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Bernarde femme au saulnier de la Neufville

prior_accusations.context: Mother Margueritte femme Dieudonné Marond executed as witch 7 years earlier (c. 1602)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Mourxat
notable_quotes.french: said she would never forgive him
notable_quotes.english: said she would never forgive him
notable_quotes.context: After he spoke about her suspicious behavior at communion

notable_quotes.speaker: Sebille Pescheur (to Sabel femme Demenge Ganaire)
notable_quotes.french: que s'il mouroit qu'on diroit qu'elle en seroit cause et qu'elle leur avoit porté grande hayne du passé, mais que pour lors cela estoit passé, a cause de l'accord qu'ils avoient eu par ensembles
notable_quotes.english: that if he died they would say she was the cause and that she had borne them great hatred in the past, but that for now that was past, because of the accord they had together
notable_quotes.context: During illness of Demenge Ganaire's son

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Demenge Mathieu (about Sebille touching her son)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'y avoit point de plus gentil que luy en leur maison
notable_quotes.english: that there was no one more handsome than him in their house
notable_quotes.context: Sebille touched her son Claude as he passed her house, shortly before he became ill

relationships.evidence_text: Father had been Demenge Jean Mathieu
latter had come to la Neufville 14 years before on second marriage to Dieudonné Marond
Mother, Marguitte femme Dieudonné Maronde, executed 7 years earlier
two of their daughters had died - Chrestienne (5)
two of their daughters had died - Marguitte (3)

economic_context.details: Multiple witnesses testified to disputes over milk and butter being refused. Legal dispute between husbands over 'retraicte' of land. Claudon Mathieu broke promise to lend 2 ecus to Sebille. Evidence of Sebille requesting food items (milk, butter) from neighbors suggests poverty. One confession mentioned killing child 'in pity at her illness' which resulted from 'their poverty'.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill suddenly; 4 recovered after 3 days, other 2 only gradually
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had taken her husband to court 3 years before to obtain reparation for insults

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sickened and had to be killed after languishing for 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Spoke to others about suspicious communion behavior

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became strangely ill; whole body affected and thought he would suffocate. Trouble moved to shoulder after Sebille passed hand over stomach.
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Boy had beaten Sebille's son (per confession)
Very angry after he went drinking with her husband; complained they refused her milk

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became very ill and languished for 10 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husbands had been to law over 'retraicte' of a plot of land

harms_catalog.harm_description: Kind of fever for which no cure could be found, suffering for a year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Several times quarrelled with daughter when living in their house

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died suddenly after being ill for a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Previous Christmas Sebille had been very angry when she refused her milk

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost use of legs for 8 weeks, then mentally ill for 2 years
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Hatred over a towel she had wanted returned
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; strange events (sparks from fire, animal like foal dropped beside her)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness told her she was 'bien sot' to go see child of Demenge Mathieu when suspected of bewitching him
Several refusals of milk and butter

harms_catalog.harm_description: Delivery took two days and child was stillborn
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel at time of last harvest
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; cat came at night and jumped on bed

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became strangely ill and remained so for some time
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Remembered he had promised to lend 2 ecus to Sebille but had already spent them

harms_catalog.victim_name: small daughter of Jean de Liepvre
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: none - said she killed in pity at illness caused by poverty

harms_catalog.victim_name: small daughter of Nicolas Jacat of Thiaville
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: child was with other children when animals damaged their field
his wife had sold her some bad cheese

harms_catalog.harm_description: Used powder to test it on hen which died

material_culture.context: Secured 'par subtile moien' from Sebille's house to cure Claude; also used for Demenge Ganaire's son
Multiple witnesses mention refusing milk to Sebille; appears to be common request
Refused to Sebille by Nicolle femme Jean Dauphin
Wife of maire Nicolas Mercier sold Sebille bad cheese
Dispute with Roze femme Didier Chottey over towel she wanted returned
Claudon Mathieu bought broom at La Chapelle for 2 ecus
Devil gave her money which turned to leaves
Given by devil: black to kill/cure, white to heal, yellow to make ill
Amount promised to lend to Sebille by Claudon Mathieu
Payment to devil (one hen around St John every year); also used to test powder
Got into fire and threw out great sparks
Child in cradle had to be saved from sparks

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Birthplace of Sebille; location of Nicolas Jacat whose daughter she confessed to killing
Home of several accomplices named at sabbat
Location of sabbat attended by accused
Location of communion incident witnessed by Jean Mourxat

economic_hardship_indicators: Poverty mentioned as cause of child's illness
religious_calendar_references: Easter or day of Jubilee (communion incident)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Chrestien Brabans had taken Sebille's husband to court 3 years before to obtain reparation for insults
Husbands of Sebille and Sabel femme Demenge Ganaire had been to law over 'retraicte' of a plot of land

hearsay_chains.content: Confirmed she was the woman involved in communion incident

emotional_state_notes: Claimed she would not have fled if she knew of arrest
Said she pardoned Jean Mourxat and did not want to charge her soul on his account

third_parties.name: Margueritte femme Dieudonné Marond
third_parties.context: Executed as witch 7 years earlier; her execution significantly affected Sebille's reputation

third_parties.name: Dieudonné Marond
third_parties.context: Second husband of Sebille's mother Margueritte

third_parties.name: Claude (son of Demenge Mathieu)
third_parties.context: Became ill after Sebille touched him; later cured when family obtained bread, salt, and ashes from her house

third_parties.name: Demenge (son of Demenge Ganaire, age 4)
third_parties.context: Became very ill and languished for 10 weeks; cured with bread, salt, and ashes from Sebille's house

third_parties.name: Nicolas Jacat
third_parties.context: Of Thiaville; Sebille confessed to killing his small daughter

third_parties.name: Nicolas Mercier
third_parties.context: Mayor; Sebille confessed to killing his cow because wife sold her bad cheese

third_parties.name: Colas de Mazellay
third_parties.context: Sebille confessed to killing his cow because wife refused her milk

third_parties.name: son of Sebille Pescheur
third_parties.context: Had been beaten by Claude son of Demenge Mathieu, precipitating Sebille's revenge

third_parties.name: first wife of Roze's husband
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: deceased former wife of witness #12's husband
third_parties.context: Sebille claimed to have lent towel to her

third_parties.name: Nicolas Brabant
third_parties.context: Sebille confessed to making his oxen ill, then curing them

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with 21 witnesses, detailed confession under torture, and execution. Rich detail on economic disputes, food requests, and healing practices. Notable use of counter-magic (bread, salt, ashes) by community members. Mother's execution 7 years earlier heavily influenced reputation.
